proposal: #396 - Chopsticks Web for dry run governance proposals and more
rationale: Bryan Chen developed Chopsticks Web tool that supports dry run preimages, OpenGov proposals,Gov1 council motions etc.
details: This is a very valuable tool for testing proposals an on-chain actions that saves time to devs, that's why we support it.

rationale: Unique Network team works on a solution to allow NFTs to be transferred between different blockchains via XCM.
details: NFT XCM is a crucial addition for Polkadot's full interoperability potential. Big AYE from us

proposal: #345 - Lark Davis - Proposal for Funding Polkadot Content Creation
rationale: CryptoLark proposes a content creation project for Polkadot worth 21,000 DOT over six months.
details: Lark is an OG in YouTube space. He is a good educator and this amount seems reasonable for the work he is going to do.

rationale: This proposal aims to accumulate USDT for Fellowship salaries through DCA orders, swapping DOT for USDT via HydraDX Omnipool.
details: We support this initiative for diversifying the Treasury, benefiting Fellowship salaries, the DOT token, and ecosystem efficiency.

proposal: #247 - Tip for N4DRO for his forensic analysis of addresses associated with recent voting behavior
rationale: This referendum aims to tip 5 KSM to N4DRO for swift on-chain analysis.
details: Tipping N4DRO for swiftly analyzing addresses involved in Kusama referenda could help to safeguard network security. That's why we voted AYE.

rationale: By that referendum approved, HydraDX will add GLMR to the Omnipool.
details: Having GLMR in the Omnipool will boost the usage of it, which will benefit both HydraDX and Moonbeam.
